children.name: to really mean what you say
serious b1
children.definition: serious to really mean what you say or really intend to do sht: nghiêm túc
examples: do you think she was serious when she said she used to be an actress?
listen! i’m serious! i’m not lending you any more money!
deadly seriousextremely serious cực kì nghiêm túc
her voice suddenly sounded deadly serious.
perfectly/absolutely seriousserious in a situation where it is hard to believe that sb could be
‘look!’ he said, ‘i am perfectly serious. i’m willing to give you $10,000 for your land.’
serious about
tina’s quite intelligent, but she’s not really serious about her schoolwork.
serious about doing sth
i hope jeff’s serious about giving up smoking.
get serious about sthstart dealing with a problem in a determined way
car manufacturers should get serious about making security a design priority.
seriously[adv] b1 if you say or do sth seriously, you really mean it, really intend to do it, or really think it is important: nghiêm túc, thực sự
are you seriously suggesting that she should give up her job in order to look after her husband?
seriously intend/want/attempt etc to do sth
those who seriously attempt to kill themselves usually manage to do so.
seriously concerned/interested/worried etc
she was talking about children’s social education at a time when no one else was seriously concerned with it.

children.name: mean x
children.definition: mean if sb means what they say, they are being serious when they say it, and they are not pretending or lying : nói thật
examples: i want you home by midnight. and i mean midnight.
mean itespeciallyspoken thật sự có ý như vậy
give it back now! i mean it .
i mean it - i’ll scream if you don’t let me go.
she told me she loved me - but i wasn’t sure if she meant it.
mean what you sayi meant what i said, i never want to see you again.

children.name: not joking b1
children.definition: not joking if you say you are not joking, you really mean what you say, even though it seems surprising or unlikely: không đùa
examples: there must be about 10 of them in that car - i’m not joking.
she told him she’d call the police if he bothered her again, and she wasn’t joking.

children.name: mean business x
children.definition: mean business spoken to be serious about doing sth even if it involves harming sb: ko đùa cợt
examples: the man had a gun. it was obvious he meant business.
the border is guarded by troops who mean business.

children.name: be in earnest x
children.definition: be in earnest if sb is in earnest, they really mean what they say, especially when they are saying what they want or what they intend to do : nghiêm túc
examples: i’m sure he was in earnest when he said he wanted to marry her.
be very much in earnest
she spoke lightly, but it was obvious that she was very much in earnest.

children.name: to believe sb really means what they say
take sb seriously b2
children.definition: take sb seriously to believe that what sb says or does is serious, and worth paying attention to:
examples: kevin paused for a moment, not sure if ralph would take him seriously.
he said he was going to build a boat in his back yard, but i didn’t take him seriously!

children.name: spoken: be serious or ask if sb is serious
really a2
children.definition: really spoken say this to emphasize that sth surprising is really true, or to ask whether sth surprising is really true: thật sự
examples: really?
‘it took three hours to travel ten miles, the traffic was so bad.’ ‘really? you must be exhausted.’

children.name: no kidding x
children.definition: no kidding especially us, spoken say this when you think other people will not believe that you are telling the truth, or to ask if sb is joking because what they say does not seem true: không đùa
examples: i’m telling you, this guy’s as fast as carl lewis -- no kidding!
‘she’s getting married again.’ ‘no kidding?’

children.name: in all seriousness x
children.definition: in all seriousness spoken used to show that what you say next is not a joke, especially because it is important: nghiêm túc mà nói
examples: he asked me, in all seriousness, if i would marry him next week.
she had heard someone say, in all seriousness, that women would never make good golfers because of the shape of their bodies.
in all seriousness, if tom does resign, a lot of other people will start leaving too.

children.name: joking apart x
children.definition: joking apart/aside uk spoken say this to show that you are now being serious about sth, after you and other people have been joking about it: đùa chứ ...
examples: joking apart, i do feel somebody should tell him what we think. it’s for his own good.

children.name: seriously b2
children.definition: seriously spoken say this to emphasize that sth surprising is really true, or to ask whether sth surprising is really true: thật sự
examples: seriously?
‘she’s quit her job. ’seriously?"

children.name: intense c2
children.definition: intense sb who is intense is serious and has very strong feelings or opinions – used to show disapproval: khắc nghiệt
examples: an intense young man
she’s a little too intense for me.

children.name: serious b1
children.definition: serious sb who is serious is quiet and sensible, and does not seem to enjoy laughing and joking : nghiêm túc
examples: friends described him as a serious and thoughtful man.
serious about
laura was always very serious about her work.

children.name: earnest x
children.definition: earnest sb who is earnest is very serious or too serious, and believes that what they say or do is very important - use this especially about sb who is young or not very experienced : nghiêm túc, nghiêm chỉnh
examples: one earnest young man asked de mille about the philosophical meaning of his films.
a group of earnest musicians dressed completely
in black earnestly[adv] theo cách nghiêm túc
the men began to talk earnestly about protecting the earth for future generations.

children.name: sober c2
children.definition: sober sb who is sober is very serious and thinks carefully about things, and does not laugh or joke very often: nghiêm túc
examples: i went to see professor dandavate, a sober and respected academic.
a sober-looking man in a grey suit

children.name: have no sense of humour b1
children.definition: have no sense of humouruk /have no sense of humorus  sb who has no sense of humour does not understand jokes, funny situations, etc - use this especially when you think sb like this is annoying or boring: ko có óc hài hước
examples: he didn’t laugh at any of my jokes. maybe taxi drivers just don’t have a sense of humor.
my grandmother didn’t have much of a sense of humour, and she could never understand what we were laughing about.

children.name: humourless x
children.definition: humourlessuk /humorlessus  sb who is humourless never laughs at anything and never tries to be funny or tell jokes: ko hài hước
examples: i knew deaver at college, and remember him as cold, humorless, and aloof.
since the death of his wife he has become isolated, defensive and humorless.

children.name: stuffy x
children.definition: stuffy sb who is stuffy does not laugh or smile at things that other people think are funny, because they are a little formal and have old-fashioned attitudes – used to show disapproval: nghiêm nghị, ra vẻ đứng đắn
examples: victor was as old-fashioned as his father, and equally stuffy.
come on dad. don’t be so stuffy!
a stuffy old family

children.name: not do sth lightly c2
children.definition: not dosthlightly if sth is not said or treated lightly, it is said or treated in a serious way, after great thought : không hời hợt, bỡn cợt
examples: accusations like these from a top minister are notmadelightly.

children.name: serious b1
children.definition: serious if sb says or does sth in a serious way, they think that what they are saying or doing is important and should not be joked about : nghiêm túc
examples: all the other people in the office seemed to have a very serious attitude towards their work.
serious about
the band are only young, but they’re very serious about their music.

children.name: take sth seriously b2
children.definition: take sth seriously to think that sth is important, and spend a lot of time and effort on it:
examples: i wish dan would take his work more seriously.
she certainly takes her politics seriously -- she’s always out at meetings.
take life seriouslythink that everything in life is very important and serious coi trọng, quan tâm cuộc sống, cuộc đời một cách nghiêm túc
he seemed much older than he was, and took life a little too seriously.

children.name: grave x
children.definition: grave written quiet and very serious, especially because sth important or worrying has happened: nghiêm trọng
examples: holmes looked grave, and stood deep in worried thought for a minute or two.
his expression became very grave when we told him what had happened. gravely:
‘we might be too late,’ she said gravely.

children.name: solemn x
children.definition: solemn very serious because of an important or sad occasion or ceremony: nghiêm trang, trọng thể
examples: everyone stood respectfully, and looked solemn throughout the funeral service.
the judge read the verdict in a clear and solemn voice.
solemnly[adv] một cách nghiêm trang
they listened solemnly as the list of those missing at sea was read out.

children.name: sombre x
children.definition: sombreuk /somberus  sad, quiet, and serious because sth unpleasant or worrying has happened or is going to happen : nghiêm trọng
examples: they sat in somber silence.
the sun was shining brightly, but the mood was sombre.

children.name: grim c2
children.definition: grim serious and not smiling, because you are angry, upset, or worried about sth: nghiêm nghị, không lay chuyển
examples: she looked grim and upset, standing silently in the corner.
a grim-faced diplomat read out the declaration of war.
her face was grim as she told them the bad news.
later mr ashby left the court, grim-faced and silent.
grim determination
the expression on his face was one of grim determination .

children.name: keep a straight face x
children.definition: keep a straight face to stop yourself from laughing or smiling when you are joking or when you think sth is funny : mặt tỉnh bơ
examples: barbara tried to keep a straight face, but in the end she just couldn’t help laughing.
he looked so ridiculous -- i don’t know how i managed to keep a straight face.

children.name: straightfaced x
children.definition: straightfaced if you say sth straightfaced, you do not show by your expression that it is just a joke and is not really true: mặt thản nhiên như ko, mặt tỉnh bơ
examples: lea told him, completely straightfaced, that sunglasses are called moonglasses in canada.

children.name: deadpan x
children.definition: deadpan if you do or say sth funny in a deadpan way, you deliberately do or say it without smiling or laughing: mặt lạnh băng
examples: laurel and hardy played all their great comic roles completely deadpan.
the deadpan humour of tv comic paul merton
his tone was completely deadpan, and it was difficult to tell if he was joking or not.

children.name: spoken: to ask sb to be less serious
lighten up x
children.definition: lighten up spoken use this to tell sb not to be so serious about sth and to relax about it: bớt căng thẳng đi
examples: hey, lighten up! it’s only a game, you know!
‘but we’re not supposed to leave campus at lunchtime, we’ll get into trouble.’ ‘lighten up, it’ll be fine.’
oh, lighten up! i was only joking!
i wish she'd lighten up a bit.
